job summary:
Amec Foster Wheeler Environment & Infrastructure is currently accepting resumes for upcoming work in several southeastern states (including but not limited to Tennessee, Georgia, and Arkansas). These are on-call positions that will report to the Knoxville, Tennessee Office. Travel will be required.


Key Responsibilities

Primarily responsible for conducting archaeological fieldwork including pedestrian survey, shovel test and test unit excavation
Fill out forms / site records and take field notes
Take site and artifact photos and maintain photo logs
ID artifacts, participate in excavation and monitoring
Data entry

Skills / Qualifications
Required

Bachelor's degree in Archaeology, Anthropology or related field and an archaeological field school
0-2 years of field archaeology experience in addition to completion of an archaeological field school in survey and excavation techniques
Experience conducting linear Phase I surveys a plus
Requires willingness to work outdoors in rough terrain
Field excavation experience including shovel test and test unit excavation is a plus
Strong communication skills and effective writing skills
Ability to work effectively with team members as well as independently
Valid U.S. driver’s license
Must pass drug test, fit-for-duty medical exam, background check and must have a satisfactory driving record in accordance with the Company's driving (MVR) policy
Preferred

Experience in the archaeology field in Tennessee and/or Arkansas located in TN or AR preferred
Ability to be permitted to work in TN and AR
Prehistoric and historic artifact identification
Physical Demands

Ability to lift 50 lbs. or more
Ability and willingness to work outside under varying and adverse weather conditions
Ability to walk up to 8 miles a day in varying terrain

Diversity Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

education level/skills required / respon: The Department of Anthropology, University of Tennessee, invites applications for the Haslam Forensic Anthropology Postdoctoral Fellowship program....
job summary:
The Department of Anthropology, University of Tennessee, invites applications for the Haslam Forensic Anthropology Postdoctoral Fellowship program. It provides support for a motivated scholar to execute novel research using resources of the Forensic Anthropology Center, including the Anthropology Research Facility and/or the extensive collection of donated and documented skeletons of modern Americans. Teaching opportunities may also be available, if desired. Post-docs will also assist with the FAC Body Donation Program and FAC courses. The salary for this position is $50,000. There will be up to $10,000 available to support research each year of the two-year term.


Qualifications


Qualifications include a recently awarded doctoral degree, demonstration of research capability as a graduate student, and a record of external funding. Applicants are encouraged to submit collaborative research proposals to NIJ, NSF, NIH or similar granting agency prior to or upon acceptance of position. Appointment may begin as early as February 2017, for a two-year term with the possibility of renewal for a third year.

BA/BS in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or...
job summary:
The User Experience (UX) team follows a simple premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." UX Researchers strive to learn what they need and want from our products and services. As a UX Researcher, You conduct independent research, analyze real user behavior and work with User Interface Designers, Products Manager and Engineers to improve our product features and develop new ones. Your work spans across all of Google's products, and you are encouraged to identify new opportunities for user experience improvements. We strive to the connect users to the magic of our products, and your job is to make that connection intuitive and accessible.

With considerable experience, you evaluate all the features contributing to user experience, providing expertise, collaborating internally and occasionally leading projects. You contribute new processes and identify product and use requirements.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of how users experience online search.
Collect and analyze user behavior through server logs, online experiments (A/B testing), benchmark studies, lab studies, and surveys.
Work with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers, and Research Managers to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and oral presentations.
Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of work experience in an applied research setting.

Preferred qualifications:
4 years of relevant work experience, including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.
Experience with SQL, Python, SPSS and remote usability testing tools, such as Keynote or UserZoom.
Internet, search and advertising experience.
Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.

job summary:
To put it simply, we want people to use Microsoft products as their first choice! Part of that vision involves finding passionate individuals who are energized about possibilities in an ever-changing market place. 
Are you curious by technology? Are you a storyteller who can pull insights from multiple sources? If yes, we want you to consider a role within Microsoft that offers a wide scope of strategic influence and executive exposure.


Microsoft’s Research and Intelligence (RI) team within the Windows Devices Group (WDG) is a critical part of the long-term success of Microsoft. The Research and Intelligence team is looking for a passionate and creative researcher to help drive the Microsoft WDG business forward. This individual is responsible for delivering high-impact, actionable market and product insights to inform the next generation of WDG products across PCs, tablets, HoloLens, and gaming consoles as well as the social, cloud and creative apps that support these platforms.


Our goal is to help product teams innovate through the generation and application of predictive knowledge about our users, and our scope spans an exciting array of interaction methods, hardware form factors and customer scenarios.


As a User Researcher on our team, you'll become part of the engineering process and partner closely with Designers, Program Managers and Developers to be directly involved in creating compelling new experiences. You’ll share the responsibility for ensuring a successful and outstanding user experience for an entire product area, and will be expected to:

• Bring a wide range of both tested and innovative research methods to your work

• Discover and apply durable insights about people’s needs, habits, beliefs, and capabilities, to the design of products

• Execute rapid iterative studies and play a key role in making design decisions for the product

• Triangulate behavioral and subjective analytics data with qualitative research insights

• Partner with your team in creating research plans and involve and engage them in your research sessions to ensure its effectiveness

• Contribute your research and perspective through the entire product design cycle including planning, execution, and finishing


We're looking for a passionate and innovative User Researcher to join our team. Strong candidates will have the following experiences and qualities:

• 2-5 years of industry experience conducting user research and effectively partnering with development teams to improve the user experience based on research results. We will also consider outstanding new graduates.

• An advanced degree in psychology, human-computer interaction, anthropology, or a related user experience field (e.g., social sciences).

• Formal training in user-centered design practices and have both knowledge and experience with evaluative & generative methodologies spanning traditional lab studies, field research, and expert review.

• A working knowledge of research methods including experimental design, data analyses, and data synthesis.

• A strong and demonstrable history of impact and influence on product experience designs, development team partners, and the process of user experience research.


Apply today to join our influential and established team of inter-disciplinary user researchers.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

education level/skills required / respon: MS/PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, Applied Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Sociology, Anthropology, or related discipline....
job summary:
At Artefact, research is a core part of the human-centered design process. It's the means by which we generate empathy for users, identify unmet needs and new opportunities, deepen our understanding of complex systems and problem spaces, and establish points of view that inform and impact our clients’ businesses.

We are looking for a dynamic and experienced leader to help shape the future of our Insights & Strategy practice, through a mixture of practice-area leadership, program direction, client interaction, hands-on work, mentorship, and business development. This is an exceptional opportunity to influence innovation and best practices within a world-class design firm and supported by a talented team of researchers, strategists, designers and technologists. As a Director at Artefact, you will also collaborate with other leaders across the company to establish the trajectory of the business, and define and execute strategic initiatives.

Responsibilities


Develop detailed plans and recommended methodologies for research engagements, in consideration of client needs, industry best practices, budget and other requirements
Drive innovation in methods that improve the relevance, scale and efficacy of our work (e.g. via emerging research techniques such as novel approaches to fieldwork, mobile ethnography, sensing and data science, etc.)
Lead consulting engagements and multidisciplinary program teams (comprising research, strategy, design and technology)
Design and facilitate client workshops with executives and other business leaders
Manage and develop client relationships
Direct both generative and evaluative user research, and participate in hands-on work as required
Synthesize research observations and insights into meaningful opportunities; prepare findings and deliver recommendations to clients
Act as a mentor and knowledgeable resource for the research team
Act as an evangelist for the practice, both internally and externally through thought leadership

Qualifications


12+ years of experience in product design or innovation as a user researcher, design researcher, ethnographer or applied anthropologist; previous design consulting experience required, with preference for candidates who have worked in similar environments
Demonstrated mastery or multiple qualitative/quantitative research methods, with deep expertise in at least one focus area (e.g. ethnography, design research, etc.)
Experience working with Fortune 100 clients and senior executives
A point of view regarding the future of the discipline, combined with a passion for innovation and craft
Expertise with design thinking methods and processes; ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams
Exceptional verbal, writing and presentation skills
MS/PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, Applied Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Sociology, Anthropology, or related discipline
Ability to travel at least 25%, or as required by project work

Artefact is a design and innovation firm that uses strategy, human-centered design and technology to advance meaningful change. For our clients. For people. For society.

job summary:
Business & Infrastructure SolutionsEnvironment & PlanningOn-Call ArchaeologistSeattle, WAAbout ICFICF (NASDAQ: ICFI) is a global consulting and technology services provider with more than 5,000 professionals focused on making big things possible for our clients. We are business analysts, policy specialists, technologists, researchers, digital strategists, social scientists and creatives. Since 1969, government and commercial clients have worked with ICF to overcome their toughest challenges on issues that matter profoundly to their success. Key markets and practices include environmental planning and policy development, impact and risk assessment, evaluation and compliance, and restoration and conservation.

ICF works at the center of environmental and sustainable programs, helping clients consider the impact of economics, health, policy, culture, and climate on the world's ecosystem. To explore global career opportunities in ICF's environment and climate programs, visit www.icf.com/careers.Job DescriptionICF is currently seeking On-Call (Temporary) Archaeologists for project sites in the Seattle, WA area. These individuals will assist senior archaeologists in fieldwork, laboratory analysis, monitoring, and preparation of technical reports and environmental documents.About On-Call Employment with ICF InternationalGiven the seasonal or project-specific nature of our environmental work, ICF often hires environmental professionals as "On-Call" employees. On-Call employees are scheduled for work hours as they become available (we usually schedule work hours a few weeks ahead of time), and each on-call employee is free to accept or refuse the hours assigned to them in a given week.

On-Call employees may work concurrent projects outside of their ICF assignment (along as their outside work does not create a conflict of interest with the work they do for ICF).Key ResponsibilitiesDuties will include surveys, testing, evaluation, data recovery, and construction monitoring, as well as other tasks as assigned. Position requires artifact analyses, keeping of field notes and records, and writing key sections of reports (methods, results, artifact analyses).Basic Qualifications* B.A. Degree or higher in Anthropology with an emphasis in Archaeology* Knowledge of computers and GPS equipment* Ability/willingness to travel* Excellent verbal and written communication skills* 2 years of field experience in archaeological survey and reconnaissance* Additional experience in historical archaeology, historic architecture, ethnography or GIS is a plus, as is prior archaeological experience in Washington, Oregon, and/or Idaho.ICF offers an excellent benefits package, an award winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce. ICF is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels.

(EEO/AA – Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities) For a listing of other career opportunities at ICF, please visit our Career Center at https://careers.icfi.com.

job summary:
Our product studios are responsible for pioneering innovative experiences for Microsoft HoloLens and future Windows products. 
We are ready to change the world again and we need your help! We’re a rapidly growing team of experienced incubators and application developers working with truly inspiring technology. We brainstorm exciting and ground-breaking experiences and quickly build working prototypes on top of emerging technology. We transform our ideas into reality through shipping first-to-market products. We offer a fun, collaborative, fast-paced work environment focused on helping to shape the future.


We are looking for an authority in product strategy (preferably consumer) with a stellar track record who loves to learn and pursue new challenges. You should have deep expertise in creating products and the flexibility to apply it to new technology and business areas. You know how to apply differentiated research, pulling in data and input from diverse industries and sources, as well as driving experiential research. You’re looking to make significant contributions to the early stages of a major initiative with huge growth potential, and you’re ready for the challenges and opportunities of working in a fast-paced incubation environment within a large company.


Responsibilities:


Own end-to-end strategy and business insight working closely with Product Owner


Lead key work streams including market research, roadmap planning, monetization design and retention optimization


Propose/execute strategies that successfully and measurably improve retention and monetization


Work across teams to pull together strategic initiatives from high level vision through execution plan


React quickly but thoughtfully to unexpected changes in prioritization, opportunity, and resources


Consistently measure impact and adjust to maintain momentum - live a data-based culture


Effectively communicate across multiple audiences in a professional and respectful manner


Maintain a high degree of diligence on driving project forward against bold timelines


Looking for someone with:

Description

HDR has partnered with clients to shape communities and push the boundaries of what's possible since 1917. We specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services.

With nearly 10,000 employees in more than 225 locations around the world, we think global and act local.

The Ethnographer will be expected to assist the senior HDR ethnography staff and conduct NEPA and Section 106/110 compliance based ethnographic field investigations with traditional communities and Native American tribes in the Pacific Northwest, Midwest, Southwest and Pacific regions. Primary duties include the application of standard ethnographic and ethno-historical techniques and procedures for assessing culture-environment relations and impacts and identifying, documenting, and evaluating traditional cultural properties as outlined in NHPA Bulletin 38. Other responsibilities include client and subcontractor correspondence, community/tribal outreach, ethnographic and oral history interviews, site visits and field documentation, data management and technical writing. Periodic travel will be required for this position. The successful candidate must be someone who enjoys and is committed to ethnographic fieldwork. This position is less than full time and there may be intermittent work periods depending on project assignments.

Qualifications

MA in Cultural Anthropology, Cultural Geography, Cultural Studies, Native American Studies or a cognate field of study. (no pending thesis)

Knowledge of NEPA and NHPA regulations and meet standards set forth in National Register Bulletin 38.

Knowledge and appreciation for cultural beliefs and practices

At least 2 years of academic and/or professional experience conducting ethnographic research with heritage communities and/or Native American tribes.

Strong preference will be given to candidates with direct experience conducting ethnographic research for cultural resources projects.

Experience with Microsoft Office Suite and GPS is preferred.

Self-starter with excellent writing and communication skills.

Willingness to travel and work under varied weather conditions.

Must provide 2 writing samples with resume and be willing to complete writing assignment during interview period.

An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must.

job summary:
Green River College welcomes faculty who have a commitment to excellence in teaching and the ability to utilize a variety of methods and modes of instruction to ensure student success. Given the diversity of our student population, we encourage applications from faculty who can adapt teaching methods to a wide range of student backgrounds and interests.


The Social Science Division at Green River College is seeking innovative and creative faculty who are committed to establishing positive working relationships with students, colleagues, staff and administrators.


Position Responsibilities:


POSITION DESCRIPTION:


The Social Science Division is accepting applications to be considered for adjunct instruction for Fall Quarter 2016 . Adjunct instructors are appointed quarter to quarter based on student enrollment.


Courses: SOC 215: Survey of Criminology


Covers the history and theory of what causes or contributes to crime, covering the major issues that confront the criminal justice system and studying the social organizations that create and enforce definitions of deviance and crime. Course is interdisciplinary in nature, working primarily from a sociological perspective, but including theories from biology, genetics, anthropology and psychology.


Courses: SOC& 101: Introduction to Sociology


Introduces the scientific study of life in groups. Examines the creation and reinforcement of cultural patterns that influence individuals, groups and society at large. Emphasizes socialization processes, social institutions, small and large group dynamics, social inequalities and social movements.


Qualifications:


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:


Master's Degree in Sociology


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS :


Successful teaching experience at the college level


Supplemental Information:


SALARY:


The starting salary listed below includes payment for outside class preparation, evaluation, and meeting with students as needed before or after class to assist them with learning problems associated with course materials. The total amount per class is based on the degree and mode of instruction.

job summary:
IHME

The Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) is an independent research center identifying the best strategies to build a healthier world. By measuring health, tracking program performance, finding ways to maximize health system impact, and developing innovative measurement systems, IHME provides a foundation for informed decision-making that ultimately will lead to better health for people worldwide.

Description

Fellows at the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) impact the health of billions of people by analyzing data and developing new tools. At IHME, we analyze the world's health data to make better decisions about important health problems. This requires insights from a variety of fields, from computer science to anthropology.

The Post-Bachelor Fellowship provides a unique opportunity for recent college graduates with strong quantitative skills to train with faculty and senior researchers on a variety of global health projects. Post-Bachelor Fellows (PBFs) use creativity to solve complex global health problems. As a PBF, you will join a community of passionate researchers in our dynamic research institute. We value diversity, innovation, and critical-thinking.

The Post-Bachelor Fellowship program combines academic research, education and training, and professional work with progressive on-the-job training and mentoring from an illustrious group of professors and researchers. Through research, training workshops, coursework, and field experience in developing countries as well as active mentorship and advising, the PBF program aims to produce the next generation of scholars and leaders in global health measurement and evaluation.

Learn more about the PBF program and IHME at: http://www.healthdata.org/post-bachelor-fellowship .

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree and proven quantitative and analytical skills. High academic potential and a strong interest in pursuing global health research and gaining coding skills. No background in global health or a related field is required.

Apply online at : http://www.healthdata.org/post-bachelor-fellowship/application-process

Deadline : January 10, 2017

Application Requirements

Resume (2 page limit)

Academic transcript

One letter of reference from a professor/professional familiar with your coursework or research

Brief personal statement (500 word max.) on how your skills, experience and long term career goals contribute to your candidacy

job summary:
The Advertising Experience and Technology team (AXT) seeks a passionate and pragmatic UX Researcher to help build the next generation of experiences and tools for advertisers and consumers alike. In this role, you will have significant impact on the Amazon advertising business by executing innovative and influential primary research that shapes a rapidly growing advertising products and services, such as Sponsored Products and Amazon Marketing Services.


You will be responsible for driving a research strategy and implementing it, possibly inventing some new research techniques and technologies along the way. In addition to working closely with your research peers in across Amazon, you will interact daily with product managers, designers, and engineers to understand and guide the team’s research needs (known and unknown), including designing and conducting all UX research, and diving deep into the data to bring forward customer insights that drive product invention. Ideal candidates will have experience applying a variety of UX research methods in a fast-paced and rapidly changing product development environment. You will be comfortable diving deep into complex subject matter to help shape the direction of new product designs and will regularly step back to ask big questions that impact the overall customer experience. This role requires the ability to collaborate with and influence others including designers, engineers, business owners and executives. Most importantly, it requires a relentless determination to do what is right for Amazon's customers.


Responsibilities

Identify and prioritize research questions based on analysis of existing product designs, business needs, project goals and risks.
Employ the best research method(s) based on research questions, timeline and resourcing.
Perform quick but thorough data analysis in order to create insightful and actionable results.
Communicate results and opportunities in clear, concise, and compelling ways to all levels of management.
Drive impact, as measured by changes to the product design and development roadmap.
Eagerness to continually learn, grow and improve the craft of UX research.

Basic Qualifications
5+ years of hands-on experience conducting UX research in an applied setting.

BA/BS in experimental psychology, cognitive science, human computer interaction or related discipline.
Working knowledge of behavioral statistics and the principles of experimental design.
A strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience, deliverables, and the ability to extract actionable insights from qualitative data.

Preferred Qualifications
7+ years of hands-on experience conducting UX research in an applied setting.
MA/MS in experimental psychology, human computer interaction, anthropology, or related discipline.
Strong command of quantitative, behavioral analysis and statistics.
Advertising and/or E-commerce UX research experience. *LI-IA2

About Olympic College

Olympic College is a public two-year community college that educates more than 13,000 students a year. Founded in 1946, the college has three campuses in Bremerton, Poulsbo, and Shelton and serves a population of 280,000 residents living in Kitsap and Mason Counties and is accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. Olympic College enriches our diverse communities through quality education and support so students achieve their educational goals. We have been recognized as one of 10 finalists for the 2015 Aspen Prize for Community College Excellence, which is the nation's preeminent recognition of high achievement and performance in America's community colleges. Located in Bremerton, WA, OC is one hour by ferry from Seattle and three hours from Bellingham, Tacoma and Portland. We are currently building a new state of the art College Instructional Center that will house Art, Music, Dramatic Arts and Health Occupations, as well as a full media Art Gallery, a multi-use theater, and several multi-use spaces.

Our product studios are responsible for groundbreaking innovative experiences for Microsoft HoloLens and other Windows devices. 
We’ve only scratched the surface on the consumer experiences, commercial solutions and business models that will unlock this market and we’re looking for creative professionals who look at problems in unique ways to join our team.

We’re a rapidly growing team of experienced incubators and application developers working with truly inspiring technology. Our Business Design Team sits within the engineering team and drives product strategy across a portfolio of apps and services that cover a breadth of customer segments (e.g. consumers, enterprises, developers) and form factors (e.g. PC, tablets, mobile, HoloLens and hardware).

Role:

As a member of the team you will be responsible for identifying fast-growing markets, portfolio strategy, and working across design and engineering to develop products that achieve high user retention and profitable revenue growth. You will quickly synthesize large amounts of market data and customer insights in order to prioritize the features that matter most to customers.


WDG.WEX

Strategic thought leadership, solid technical acumen, rigorous quantitative modeling skills and strong design thinking are all required to be successful in this role. Job Purpose
As a member of The Nerdery’s Solutions Design team, you will work closely with Sales Directors, Account Executives, and Solutions Engineers (“Sales”) to win new strategic opportunities and help to convert Tier II and III Strategic Accounts to Tier I accounts. You will draw on contextual knowledge from experience with Sales Vertical industries in order to ideate, design, estimate, and propose solutions to new and existing strategic clients. Deep knowledge of the industries (e.g. market value, competitive landscape, regulations, and industry terminology) will empower you to be exceptionally empathetic and consultative to clients who fall within one, and to tailor custom solutions to them.
Solutions Architects are able to rapidly build domain knowledge, evaluate symptoms and root causes, facilitate discovery/definition workshops, and explain findings to clients with a breadth of technical and business awareness. Solutions Architects apply Design Thinking principles to identify and define business problems, correlate related constraints and requirements, and ideate and propose sound solutions to them. Solutions Architects drive toward The Nerdery’s sales goal by providing dedicated consultative, technical sales support to Sales team throughout the entire the sales lifecycle, with a focus on generating new business and helping to secure new accounts for The Nerdery . Duties Provide strategic support to the Sales Team during all aspects of the sales process, including but not limited to sales calls, sales meetings, partner briefings, estimate creation and delivery, and scope of work writing assistance Responsible for the effectiveness of technical, engagement, and strategy decisions during the sales planning process with account executives, clients, and potential clients of The Nerdery , in alignment with a Branch/ Sales Director and/or Sales Vertical Responsible for effective delegation to and collaboration with subject matter expert resources during the sales process Responsible for collaborating with Sales to identify accounts that can be targeted for consultative opportunity development Conceptualize, propose, and conduct intensive Solutions Workshops with our clients in order to clearly define business problems and opportunities; Skills/Qualifications Experience and a driving passion to grow your domain knowledge within one or more of The Nerdery’s Sales Verticals and the industries they encompass (Healthcare, Retail, Industrial/Manufacturing, Media/Services) Advanced understanding of Design Thinking process and principles, and a passion for problem solving Advanced understanding of Sales department processes and resources Understanding of The Nerdery’s service offerings Advanced understanding of a variety of software development processes, design patterns, and methodologies Demonstrates strong business acumen Excellent written, verbal, visual, technical and nontechnical communication skills Demonstrates strong organizational and time management skills Strong analysts with the ability to distill root causes from symptoms, and root requirements for prescribed solutions Holistic, long-term thinking Experience working in multiple business domains Strong business and technology architecture experience Capable of understanding the impact of business requirements on the technologies being used to implement Able to reconcile and articulate ideas for many audiences; strong technical communication skills

Description

P&G; serves consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ambi Pur®, Ariel®, Bounty®, Charmin®, Crest®, Dawn®, Downy®, Fairy®, Febreze®, Gain®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Lenor®, Olay®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, SK-II®, Tide®, Vicks®, and Whisper®. The P&G; community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide. Please visit http://www.pg.com for the latest news and information about P&G; and its brands.

Research Technician – Research and Development

Do you want to work in a lab? Are you interested in doing the hands-on research for new product development? If so, continue on to learn more about Research Technician jobs at Procter & Gamble and Apply Today!

Your Organization & Mission

We employ nearly 7,000 Research & Development (R&D;) employees in 11 countries around the globe. We have state-of-the-

art innovation centers and more depth and breadth in science and technology resources than any consumer products

company in the world, resulting in over 55,000 patents and applications globally. Our science, Scientists, Engineers, and

Researchers consistently receive numerous prestigious awards.

We are looking for engineering, chemical, and biological

technicians

to work in a wide variety of exciting areas:
Analytical Researchers -

conduct chemical, biological, and physical tests of new and/or improved technologies or products

using state-of-the-art analytical instrumentation

Product Researchers - designing and carrying out consumer research studies

Packaging Researchers - develop technically sophisticated packaging, materials, and design

Formulation Researchers -

develop chemical and mechanical processes required for formulation and manufacturing of

consumer products and industrial intermediates

Process Researchers -

convert ideas, concepts, and technologies into commercially feasible processes

Biology Researchers -

use a variety of research and development applications in the discovery of new products; assay

and model development; efficacy testing; and product evaluations

The Ideal Candidate

As a key member of the R&D; organization, you will be expected to learn existing tools and techniques for testing products while collaborating with team members to execute tests that lead to new product designs. We will help you achieve your goals by providing world class training and development opportunities.

Qualifications

Requirements

Minimum of High School Diploma with relevant experience, Preferred Associates Degree in Biology, Chemistry, Anthropology, Psychology, Sociology, or Engineering Technology

Experience in biology, chemistry, or social science labs is preferred.

Ability to learn on the job in a fast paced environment

education level/skills required / respon: BA/BS in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or...
job summary:
User Experience (UX) Researchers work to answer the most challenging questions in design. In this role, you will reveal what our users need from our products by conducting primary research, exploring the behaviors and motivations of our users, and working with teams of Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and others to develop new features. You’ll inspire change at all stages of product development by delivering exciting oral, written and visual presentations about our findings. Most importantly, your job as a researcher is to help the UX team understand what would make a user’s experiences feel more intuitive, accessible, fun—and even magical.
With considerable experience, you evaluate all the features contributing to user experience, providing expertise, collaborating internally and occasionally leading projects. You contribute new processes and identify product and use requirements.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of how users experience online search.
Collect and analyze user behavior through server logs, online experiments (A/B testing), benchmark studies, lab studies, and surveys.
Work with designers, product managers, engineers, and research managers to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and oral presentations.
Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of work experience in an applied research setting.

Preferred qualifications:
4 years of relevant work experience, including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.
Experience with SQL, Python, SPSS and remote usability testing tools, such as Keynote or UserZoom.
Internet, search and advertising experience.
Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.

Job title: User Experience Researcher, Verily Life Sciences
education level/skills required / respon: BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science, Human Factors or...
job summary:
Note: this role may provide an opportunity to be based either in South San Francisco or Mountain View, but you’ll likely be splitting time between the two locations depending on project needs.
Verily Life Sciences is focused on shifting health care from a reactive, undifferentiated approach to a proactive, targeted approach by transforming the detection, prevention, management and even our basic understanding of disease.
As a User Experience Researcher at Verily Life Sciences, you will work on developing hardware and software for a wide range of medical products. You will work closely with with designers, engineers, product managers and other stakeholders to ensure that our products are user-friendly.
The Verily Life Sciences team is focused on helping to move healthcare from reactive to proactive. Combining expertise from the fields of biology, chemistry, physics, medicine, electrical engineering, computer science, we’re developing new technology tools for physicians that can integrate easily into daily life and help transform the detection, prevention, and management of disease. Current projects in development include a smart contact lens with miniaturized glucose sensor ; a nanodiagnostics platform to help with early detection of disease ; and Liftware utensils for people with tremor. For more information, please see our website .
Responsibilities
Conduct independent research using a wide range of methods (such as usability lab studies, RITE studies, interviews, field studies, literature reviews, surveys, etc.) and appropriate analysis methods.
Help drive change through effective communication of research findings to stakeholders.
Identify new opportunities for high-impact research and execute on them.
Advocate user-centered thinking to product teams successfully.
Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science, Human Factors or related field or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience conducting studies in the health space; experience with IRB approvals and/or clinical protocols.
Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of multiple different research methods, including basic understanding of experimental design and statistics.
Self-motivated and comfortable in a fast-paced, fluid environment, and able to execute with a high level of autonomy while keeping everyone on the same page.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, and collaboration skills -- including ability to distill findings into concise insights that engage and excite stakeholders about research.

education level/skills required / respon: Responsibilities Work closely with product and business teams to identify research topics Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes Generate...
job summary:
Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. 

Come join a diverse and collaborative team of researchers who work directly with product designers and engineers to make the best social platform for Facebook's billion users. Our work ranges from formative to evaluative, from ethnography to experimentation, and it involves collaboration between qualitative and quantitative researchers. For this position, we are looking for people with strong skills in qualitative and mixed methods, including product-focused lab studies, usability evaluation, contextual inquiry, surveys, interviews, focus groups, and rapid ethnography.


The right candidates will be excellent communicators, knowledgeable about UI design, passionate about social platforms, comfortable in a flat, fast-moving organization, excited to collaborate, and focused squarely on bringing compelling and relevant online experiences to as many people as possible around the world. 
Responsibilities Work closely with product and business teams to identify research topics 
Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes 
Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs 
Conduct research using a wide variety of methods, and interpret analysis through the lens of UX, HCI, and social science 
Collaborate closely with quantitative researchers 
Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing 
Partner with engineers, analysts, and other technical roles to create and share research 
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways 
Requirements MS/PhD in human-computer interaction, anthropology, sociology, communication, market research, information science, or a related field 
Interest in and experience executing hands-on, primary research 
3+ years of experience in applied product research preferred 
Experience with survey research (questionnaire design, sampling, analysis) 
Experience with SQL and Python a plus 
Experience conducting international/cross-cultural research preferred 
Experience with user research supporting accessibility highly desirable 
Ability to ask, as well as answer, meaningful and impactful questions 
Ability to communicate complex analysis and results compellingly to a lay audience 
Apply Facebook is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. 
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com or you may call us at 1+650-308-7837.

job summary:
User Experience (UX) Researchers work to answer the most challenging questions in design. In this role, you will reveal what our users need from our products by conducting primary research, exploring the behaviors and motivations of our users, and working with teams of Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and others to develop new features. You'll utilize your extensive experience to evaluate all the features contributing to user experience, providing expertise, collaborating internally and occasionally leading projects. You'll contribute new processes and identify product and use requirements.
X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].
Responsibilities
Contribute to, and/or lead key formative, generative, and evaluative research activities including domain research, expert interviews, field research, lab studies, surveys, design brainstorms, etc.
Collaborate cross-functionally with Engineers, Product Managers, Researchers, and Designers (visual/UX, motion, ID) to solve problems and prioritize user experience research questions.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and oral presentations.
Identify new opportunities for high-impact research and execute on them.
Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:
Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science, Applied Linguistics, or related field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience, including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.
Experience in statistics and the principles of experiment design.

Preferred qualifications:
PhD in a user-centered research field.
Experience in early stage research, technology incubator, design consultancy, or across multiple, diverse work domains (consumer electronics, vehicles, children’s toys, etc).
Demonstrated understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
Effective interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.

job summary:
Santa Clara University

Department, Program, Center: Environmental Studies and Sciences

Specialty or Subdiscipline: Environmental and Food Justice

College or School: College of Arts and Sciences

Purpose:
Santa Clara University

Quarterly Adjunct Lecturer

The Department of Environmental Studies and Sciences at Santa Clara University, a Jesuit, Catholic University, is receiving applications to teach one upper-division level course entitled ENVS155: Environmental and Food Justice during Winter quarter 2017. This course is scheduled for Monday/Wednesday/Friday from 1:00 p.m. - 2:05 p.m. The quarter is 10 weeks long, with an 11th week for final examinations. Classes begin the week of January 9, 2017.

After reviewing several seminal studies in environmental and food justice, this class delves into case studies in California and Central America. Learners will conduct a major research project, participate in team-based collaborations, and engage local communities as part of this course.

The class has a community-based learning component supported by the Ignatian Center's Arrupe partnerships program, as well.

Apply Now At: https://jobs.scu.edu/postings/5023

Salary: $6,500 per course

Basic Qualifications:
Ph.D. in Environmental Studies, Human Geography, Anthropology, Sociology or closely related field.

Preferred Qualifications:
Undergraduate teaching experience strongly preferred.

Responsibilities:
Faculty responsibilities are specified by the Santa Clara University Faculty
Handbook (sec. 3.6). Duties include but are not limited to: A. Teaching one lecture section of ENVS122 during Winter quarter 2017.B. Fulfilling all responsibilities associated with the assigned course, including: 1. Conducting all assigned class meetings and individual conferences with
students;
2. Assigning and evaluating student work including exams and written assignments;
3. Holding weekly office hours on campus;
4. Submitting student grades to the Office of the Registrar by the designated deadline;
5. Administering numerical and narrative course evaluations to each class as
assigned by the chair; and
6. Fulfilling other instructional or academic duties as may be assigned by the Dean
of the College of Arts and Sciences or by the Department Chair.

Work Authorization:
Santa Clara University does not sponsor any visa applications for this position. The successful candidate must be able to provide evidence of identity and legal authorization to work in the United States.

Close Date:
Open Until Filled: Yes

Special Instructions to Applicants:
Your application should include: 1. Letter of Interest: Qualifications and Relevant Experience 2. Curriculum Vitae 3. First Professional Reference Contact Information 4. Second Professional Reference Contact Information

Additional Information:
To view the full job posting and apply for this position, go to https://jobs.scu.edu

About Santa Clara University
Santa Clara University is a comprehensive Jesuit, Catholic university located in California’s Silicon Valley, offering its 8,800 students rigorous undergraduate curricula in arts and sciences, business, and engineering, plus master’s, Ph.D., and law degrees.

Distinguished by the highest retention rate and ranked second among all master’s universities in the West by U.S. News and World Report, Santa Clara University is California’s oldest operating institution of higher-education. The University is focused on creating an academic community that educates citizens and leaders who will build a more just, humane, and sustainable world.

Santa Clara University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, committed to excellence through diversity and inclusion, and, in this spirit, particularly welcomes applications from women, persons of color, and members of historically underrepresented groups. The University will provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability.

Santa Clara University annually collects information about campus crimes and other reportable incidents in accordance with the federal Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act. To view the Santa Clara University report, please go to the Campus Safety Services website at http://www.scu.edu/cs/ . To request a paper copy please call Campus Safety at (408) 554-4441. The report includes the type of crime, venue, and number of occurrences.

job summary:
Beepi is the fastest growing marketplace to buy and sell cars 100% online. Gone are the days of haggling with the used car salesman on the lot. Beepi makes the process simple, trustworthy and even fun! We combine a rigorous vehicle-certification process, an industry-leading pricing algorithm, and the world's best car-buying process to delight all our customers. Thanks to our great team, we’re changing the auto industry from the ground up.

That’s us, let’s talk about you. You've been on the Marketing scene for at least a few years; absorbing, learning, and executing. You thrive in fast-paced environments and are an action-oriented quick learner. You know what it means to work hard and play hard. But most importantly, you're hungry to LEARN what it takes to build a business that is disrupting an industry and market to its consumers.

The Digital Marketing Team was recently formed to focus on growing the business and users through different acquisition, retention, and engagement channels. We are an entrepreneurial, data-driven marketing team that is building the foundation on which Beepi will continue to grow.

RESPONSIBILITIES
----------------


Create, manage, and execute growth marketing campaigns
Compose compelling stories about our cars on various acquisition and retention channels
Support management of our social media, display, search, and email programs
Monitor and report on daily growth marketing initiatives on our social and search channels
Conduct research to gain insights on consumer behavior to make our products more discoverable on mobile and desktop
Create and execute on grassroots marketing action plans to influence Beepi’s target demographics
Execute on referral and influencer marketing
Evangelize the Beepi brand through local online channels

QUALIFICATIONS
--------------


3+ year experience in a marketing or analytics role
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Anthropology, Economics, or a related field
Entrepreneurial spirit
Superior writing skills with a natural flair for story-telling
Strong verbal communication skills and ability to network
Previously proven independent ambition requiring little supervision
Extremely organized and results-driven

job summary:
Job Description
About the Role: Human Factor Engineering (HFE) act as design-team members, lead UI evaluation efforts, partner effectively with other HFE groups and labs, and work closely with the Ease of Use community at Intel. Qualities: Highly self motivated, able to prioritize and focus on critical tasks (cut interesting chaff). Independent, but take direction input very well. Has excellent user interface design skills have proven themselves to be creative problem solvers. Excellent verbal and written communications abilities augmented with strong presentation skills. Consensus builders that can flexibly articulate the value of user-centered design in a fast-moving, highly competitive environment.Responsible for applying Human Factors Engineering techniques and principles at all phases of product/technology development, including: *End-user profiling application of market research*Requirements gathering definition*Product concept formation and qualification*Rapid, iterative user interface design, simulation, evaluation*Usability planning, delivery, tracking and closure for hardware, software, and web projects.*Formal evaluation and experimental methods for field and lab (design, collection, analysis, delivery)

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications: BA/BS in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or equivalent practical experience.Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.Preferred qualifications: 6 years of relevant work experience, including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.Excellent working knowledge of statistics, analytics and the principles of experiment design. Inside this Business Group

The Intel Security Group combines employees from McAfee and Intel – people with security expertise in hardware, software, and solutions into one business unit focused on building hardware, software, services and end-to-end security solutions. Intel Security Group sets the stage for new levels of collaboration and innovation and will drive leadership in the industry by providing ubiquitous security and identity protection for people and businesses worldwide.

education level/skills required / respon: Under the supervision of the chairs of the departments, this position serves as administrative support for the Department of Anthropology, Geography, and...
job summary:
ABOUT CSU EAST BAY:


California State University, East Bay's beautiful main campus is located in the Hayward hills with panoramic views of the San Francisco Bay shoreline. Situated above the city of Hayward, the campus offers an ideal setting for teaching and learning and yet easy access to the many cities along the bay. The University has a satellite campus in Concord, a professional development center in Oakland and a significant presence online. Founded in 1957, California State University, East Bay is one of 23 universities of the California State University system (CSU). With an enrollment over 13,800 students, California State University, East Bay is recognized as a regionally engaged and globally oriented university with a strong commitment to academic innovation, student success, engaged and service learning, diversity, and sustainability.


ABOUT THE POSITION:


Under the supervision of the chairs of the departments, this position serves as administrative support for the Department of Anthropology, Geography, and Environmental Studies, the Department of Theatre and Dance, and the International Studies Program. This position primarily supports the areas of office work; course scheduling and enrollment management; contracts and appointments, financials, procurement, and logistics.


RESPONSIBILITIES:


Office Work:

* Front-line for all in-person and telephone traffic to the Department office.

* Send and receive mail and deliveries in coordination with the appropriate campus office.

* Arrange for, and retrieve, duplicating services.

* Track and order office supplies.

* Liaise with University offices such as (but not limited to) Facilities Management and Information Technology concerning services required by the Department; follow through on arranging for services as directed.

* Schedule meetings and arrange for rooming using the 25 Live system, electronic calendaring, or other specified system.

* Organize and maintain confidential files and paperwork.

* Create, update, and delete department webpages using Cascade (or other systems) as needed.

* Take minutes at Department meetings; distribute and/or post minutes as directed.

* Data entry.

* File paper and electronic documents; scan of documents as necessary.

* Perform backup office work duties for staff assigned to the same location in the event of an absence.


Course Scheduling and Enrollment Management:

* Create and manage the course schedule; this includes, but is not limited to, creating, updating, and deleting classes.

* Liaise with the Registrars office, Campus Scheduler, and other campus entities to ensure proper creating and management of the course schedule and its components (most notably enrollment and rooming).

* Manage enrollment in specific coursework, performing add, drop, and withdrawals as needed.

* Retrieve reports on enrollment and admissions from various Pioneer Data sources, including (but not limited to) Pioneer Data Warehouse, Pioneer Analytics and Reporting, Singularity, Blackboard Analytics, and EAB.

* Process special registration petitions.

* Process late withdrawal and other special enrollment procedures.

* Collect, track, and record workload and assigned time for faculty; report workload and assigned time to the College office.

* Track and report on enrollment targets.

* Track and publish faculty office hours.

* Distribute results of student evaluations to respective faculty as specifically directed by the Department Chair.

* Prepare paper student evaluation forms in the event of a request for a paper evaluation.

* Prepare degree checks.

* Perform backup course scheduling and enrollment management duties for staff assigned to the same location in the event of an absence.


Contracts and Appointments:

* Appoint students, faculty, staff, consultants, and other workers as directed by the Department Chair; this includes, but is not limited to, creating SEAFs, creating eSAFs, eFAFs, and contracts within PeopleSoft, and 16th unit appointments.

* Create and manage staff and faculty recruitments using PeopleSoft, Interfolio, or other system.

* Submit electronic systems access requests via eSARF or other process.

* Hire and manage student assistants.

* Liaise with the College office in order to ensure proper appointment of personnel.

* Post position openings, job announcements, and lecture pool openings.

* Be knowledgeable of University personnel policies; this includes, but is not limited to, the Presidential Directive on Special Consultant Appointments and rules surrounding the appointment of student assistants (especially with regards to financial aid); when necessary,

inform students, faculty, and staff of these policies, especially when asked to perform work that may be counter to these policies.

* Record payroll for certification.

* Record employee leaves and absences.

* Approve time and labor for any student assistants or other hourly employees as directed.

* Liaise with the Leave coordinator and/or Academic Affairs to process leaves of absence as directed; this includes, but is not limited to, Family Medical Leave, catastrophic leave, leave of absence without pay, professional leave of absence, difference-in-pay leave,

sabbatical.

* Liaise with the College office on matters of contracts and appointments as required.

* Perform backup contracts and appointments duties for staff assigned to the same location in the event of an absence.


Financials, Procurement, and Logistics:

* Track and balance budgets for Department general fund, student fee funds, trusts funds, grant funds, scholarship and donation funds, and other funds.

* Process expense claims, check requests, purchase orders, and other budget and financial transaction documents.

* Procure supplies, equipment, and/or services using various University procedures and guidelines, including processing check requests, purchase orders, and short-term limited scope work forms.

* Balance and reconcile procurement card statements.

* Arrange for student, faculty, and staff individual and individual or group travel. This includes, but is not limited to, making transportation, lodging, and meal arrangements; ensuring waivers of liability are attained; permission to use private vehicles on state business are attained; and any other details of CSU travel policies and procedures are adhered to.

* Arrange and file hospitality requests and subsequent expense claims.

* Assist in the filing of travel requests and subsequent travel expense claims.

* Liaise with respective departments in Administration and Finance on matters of procurement, travel, risk management, and contracting for services.

* As directed and assisted by the Department Chair (or delegated faculty), write descriptions for services to be performed or contracted by non-University persons.

* Be knowledgeable of University financial, procurement, and logistics policies; this includes, but is not limited to, the CSU Conflict of Interest Handbook, the CSU Travel

Procedures, the CSUEB Hospitality Policy, and the Procurement Card (P-Card) program; when necessary, inform students, faculty, and staff of these policies, especially when asked to perform work that may be counter to these policies.

* Liaise with the College office on matters of procurement and logistics as required.

* Perform backup financials, procurement, and logistics duties for staff assigned to the same location in the event of an absence.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:


Requires a fully functional knowledge of and skill in standard office procedures and practices, as well as an ability to understand and operate in a variety of organizational structures. Additionally, incumbents are expected to have a thorough knowledge of English grammar, spelling, and punctuation and be able to clearly communicate orally and in writing. Some positions may require a knowledge of business mathematics beyond basic arithmetic. The ability to use and quickly learn new office support technology systems and software packages is also a prerequisite.


These entry qualifications would normally be obtained through a high school program, technical/vocational program, or their equivalents combined with several years of related office work experience.


PREFERRED SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:


* Two years skilled office experience or vocational training.

* Thorough knowledge of California State University policies and procedures.

* Excellent organizational, record keeping, interpersonal, and written and oral communication skills.

* Bookkeeping skills.

* Experience with Microsoft Excel, especially related to bookkeeping and/or simple fund accounting.

* Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities efficiently, effectively, and accurately.

* Excellent attention to detail.

* Ability to communicate effectively with diverse student, faculty, and staff population.

* Ability to use Microsoft Office, Adobe Acrobat, or equivalent office productivity software.

* Ability to use the Internet to research and gather information.

* Ability to work under pressure with constant interruptions.

* Experience handling confidential information.

* Knowledge of, or experience with, the PeopleSoft system.


SALARY:


Salary Range: $2,846.00/mo. to $4,619.00/mo. PLEASE NOTE: The anticipated starting salary will be from $2,846.00/mo. to $3,400.00/mo.


HOW TO APPLY:


In addition to the standard CSUEB application, please submit a cover letter, a list of three (3) or more professional references, and resume. Resumes alone will not be accepted in lieu of a completed online application.


To apply on-line, please go to www.csueastbay.edu/jobs. If you are a first time user, you must register, create a user ID and password, fill in your basic information, save and click on the position you are interested in, click on the "Apply Now" button to begin the online application.


This position will remain open until filled and may close without further notice.


CONDITION(S) OF EMPLOYMENT:


California State University, East Bay conducts pre-employment screening that may include, but is not limited to: criminal background check, verification of academic credentials, licenses, certificates, credit history, professional references and/or verification of work history. Candidates must submit to a background check before being offered a position with CSUEB. Unsatisfactory results of the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSUEB employees who apply for the position.


OTHER INFORMATION:


In compliance with state and federal crime awareness and campus security legislation, including The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act, the California State University East Bay Annual Campus Security Report is available at: http://www20.csueastbay.edu/af/departments/upd/campus-security-report.html


MANDATED REPORTER:


All California State University, East Bay employees are considered mandated reporters under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and are required to comply with requirements set forth in the CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.


SPONSORSHIP:


CSUEB is not a sponsoring agency for Staff or Management positions.


EEO STATEMENT:


As an Equal Opportunity Employer, CSUEB does not discriminate on the basis of any protected categories: age, ancestry, citizenship, color, disability, gender, immigration status, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran's status. The University is committed to the principles of diversity in employment and to creating a stimulating learning environment for its diverse student body.

education level/skills required / respon: Our multi-disciplinary team, with expertise in design, public health, anthropology, nursing, science, business and more, leads large scale initiatives to make...
job summary:
Do you want to make a real impact in society through design? Are you a trained designer that loves gnarly challenges and creative problem solving? Want to be a part of a team with a touted history and an exciting future? We're looking to hire 3 designers to take our team to the next level, and this position requires a minimum of 4 years of practical design experience and 2 years leading people and projects.

•

You've got a background in design.

•

You have a classic design degree and an anchor talent in your “deep T.” You've got a portfolio that shows an excitement to work across all phases of design work from research and synthesis to producing final deliverables.

•

You care about people and can lead them.

•

You are a people person. It doesn’t matter if you are extroverted or introverted—what’s important is that you have a love and fascination of people!

•

You have experience leading teams in a past or current role and you love to coach and see your team members grow.

•

You are mission-driven.

•

You have a real passion for healthcare whether or not you've worked in the industry. It's not always easy, but you don't care—it's a complicated world and you want to be part of it.

•

You are not a lone ranger.

•

You like working in a team and making the experience of others around you even better. You're excited to push a large health care organization think to big and act on its ideas.

•

You've got personality.

•

You are curious, humble, and don't take yourself too seriously. You impress others with a MacGuyver-like ability to make something out of seemingly nothing.

Details about the position

•

All positions may include up to 20% travel within the U.S.

•

When not in the field, we work out of offices in Downtown Oakland or at our Garfield Innovation Center in San Leandro.

•

A portfolio and resume are required to apply.

Learn more about the KP Innovation Consultancy

Established in 2003, the Innovation Consultancy started as a first-of-its-kind experiment to explore the value of human centered design in health care at Kaiser Permanente. Today we are a vital asset for the organization. Our multi-disciplinary team, with expertise in design, public health, anthropology, nursing, science, business and more, leads large scale initiatives to make lives better and to grow capabilities in human centered design and innovation enterprise-wide. We’re looking for a service designer to expand our capabilities and bring individual passion and expertise to the team. Our work has been featured in the Harvard Business Review, Fast Company, New York Times and numerous design and creativity books from leaders in the fields of design, innovation, and health care. We care deeply about how we practice as a team – collaboratively, thoughtfully and with joy.

•

Read about the team and our past work – http://kpinnovation.org/

•

A snapshot of how we do field research – https://hbr.org/2010/09/kaiser-permanentes-innovation-on-the-front-lines

•

Celebrate our two most recently awarded work products – http://www.dmi.org/?page=2016DVAKaiser and http://www.fastcoexist.com/3057404/world-changing-ideas/kaiser-permanente-has-designed-a-health-center-that-puts-patients-first

Essential Functions:

Position leading the design of innovations, content, and communications.
Leads the planning for scope of project with team, including background research of the topic (from a design perspective) to be innovated around.
Reviews and conducts background research of topic to assist team with understanding the current state.
Leads and participates in observation activities in the assigned area and reports to team providing insight into current practices.
Leads and participates in the analysis and synthesis activities in the assigned topic designing visual frameworks to be used in innovation in the assigned area.
Leads and participates in brainstorming new approaches to use in creating prototypes.
Leads the prototype development.
Leads and participates in the testing of prototypes to be used by the team to Field-test new ideas to determine the benefit.
Leads and participates in field-testing activities to determine the benefit of the new ideas.
Responsible for the creation of iterative prototypes as feedback is obtained.
Creates presentations to provide feedback to others documenting the findings of the innovation efforts.
Makes presentations independently or with other members of the team in reporting the results of the innovation work.
Prepares and updates and maintains communication materials, and schedules as developed.
Leads out in guiding the Innovation Consultancy internal education efforts to help educate KP around Innovation methodology using human centered design.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
Experience


Minimum four (4) years in design, innovation, or related field.
Minimum two (2) years of managing projects.

Education


Bachelor's degree required.

License, Certification, Registration


N/A

Additional Requirements:

Human Centered Design.
Metrics.
Project Management.
Thorough knowledge of policies, practices and systems.
Regularly contributes to the development of new concepts, techniques, and standards.
Considered functional expert in field within KP.
Frequently contributes to the development of new theories and methods.
Employs expertise as a generalist or specialist.
Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment.

Preferred Qualifications:
•

FA or MFA in Design (Service, Communication, Industrial, UX, or related design degree).

•

Knowledge of health care industry.

•

Experience as an active team member on design research and service design projects.

•

Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and design tools across a variety of media (print, motion, web). Specifically, InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, and AfterEffects.


P

roficient in prototyping tools (InVision, Sketch, or similar programs).
